attributes.action: Abolish school uniform in all schools.
attributes.background: School uniform rules have recently become too strict, to the point where people are being suspended from school for their appearance. We preach about not missing education yet we stop it over cloth and dye? Teenagers should express themselves and not be punished for being unique.
attributes.additional_details: When a student has done something particularly bad like get into a fight or bully another student we suspend them or put them in isolation to punish the student. Why is a student with blue hair or with a t-shirt being punished at the same level? We encourage students to 'be themselves' yet we confine this with rules. Teenagers already struggle in schools with exams, hormones, sexuality etc. We shouldn't be giving them more reasons to stress out. Casual dress-code doesn't stop them learning.

attributes.action: Start development of a satellite carrier rocket.
attributes.background: During the 1960s a British rocket named Black Arrow was created that was capable of launching payloads into orbit. However, the program was cancelled in order to save money which left the UK the only country to successfully develop and then cancel an indigenous space rocket.
attributes.additional_details:
-Black Arrow was cancelled in order to save cost, however it was a comparatively cheap rocket design.
-All other countries that have successfully developed rocket technologies have continued to develop them further.
-The lack of our own launch system has led us to rely on foreign countries, such as the Russian Soyuz rocket, which we could be prevented from using their equipment if we fall out of favour with their governments.

attributes.action: Increase the driving age to 21
attributes.background: I believe that being able to drive at 17 is far too young and the age limit should be increased to 21 to try and save lives

attributes.action: Start a voluntary emigration programme for people who want to leave the UK.
attributes.background: I am sick and tired of living in a small country with an ever increasing population and lack of government investment in jobs, housing, opportunities, transport, healthcare and poor standard of living.
attributes.additional_details:
You would be paid up to £100,000 by the Government to give up your British citizenship, if you’re entitled to another citizenship, in exchange for leaving the UK to settle elsewhere.

 

A contract can be signed, so that if someone changes their mind they will be liable to pay back the sum of money, if they want to gain back their citizenship. They will also not be able to join the scheme again.

attributes.action: All EU powers should return to Scotland, Wales and Northern Ireland after Brexit
attributes.background: The UK government is saying that they need to reserve some powers after Brexit to protect the UK single market.  But that’s not necessarily true.  What they’re proposing would actually damage the UK and the UK single market.  So I call on the UK to automatically devolve all of these EU powers.
attributes.additional_details: Devolving all these powers would might prevent the break up of the UK.  Whereas, what the UK government is proposing would actually break Britain up.  So I would like to see a cross-party discussion on this.

attributes.action: Restrict social media use by children to help prevent cyberbullying
attributes.background:
We urge Parliament to consider new laws, banning the posting of content to social media / video-sharing sites by under-18s. 

Children should be focussed on developing real life social skills, and deserve a childhood free from the pressures and bullying which go hand in hand with social media use.
attributes.additional_details:
Social media / video-sharing websites are often used as a way to bully other children, and in some cases teachers too, something from which the victim has no opportunity to escape, even at home.

Children should not be posting content online, until they have reached an age at which they have been fully educated about its use/misuse, can understand the emotional damage bullying online may cause, and the legal ramifications of broadcasting inappropriate content or making libelous remarks online.

attributes.action: Legally binding target to give men and women equal life expectancy.
attributes.background: End the worst gender inequality of them all - refocus health resources to give men and women equal life expectancy. The ONS states that the average life expectancy is 79 years for men and 83 years for women. This is a shocking discrimination against men, in the most fundamental way - life itself.
attributes.additional_details: The government should re-direct NHS resources to close the 4-year gap. No child should be born to a shorter life simply by being born male. Medical opinion is that there is no basic reason why women should live longer than men - so resources in research, treatment, health education etc. should be focused on men's health until the gap is closed.

attributes.action: Make Recycling Compulsory
attributes.background: The united kingdom is falling behind on the amount of recycling compared to other European countries. We could fix this by making recycling compulsory, a tax reduction (similar to charity donations) and education for younger generations that will encourage new generations to recycle more often.
attributes.additional_details: The United Kingdom is falling behind on recycling rates compared to other developed nations such as France and Germany causing 60% of waste going to landfill. This needs to change. I propose that we can end this through making recycling compulsory, through methods such as: an increase tax for if landfill waste increases, a tax reduction for companies that increase the percentage recycled, similar to charity donations and encouraging new generations to recycle through education within schools.

attributes.action: Reform the law on incarcerating drug addicts, introducing harm reduction clinics
attributes.background: The 'Harm Reduction' drug policy used in Switzerland in the 1980's  has had a range of positive impacts on addicts, and should be used in the UK.Two-Thirds of the addicts who entered the harm-reduction clinics found full time jobs as they did not spend their time and money financing their addiction.
attributes.additional_details:
- http://vancouver.ca/people-programs/four-pillars-drug-strategy.aspx
 - https://www.globalcommissionondrugs.org/the-hardline-approach-to-drugs-must-end-by-richard-branson/
- http://www.smh.com.au/comment/swiss-recipe-for-dealing-with-drug-addiction-proves-a-success-20130622-2opcj.html

The benefits that addicts can receive from the harm reduction strategy hugely outweighs the 'positives' brought by the more traditional, hard-line policy that punishes and incarcerates addicts which inevitably worsens their addiction and leaves them stripped of opportunities when released.

attributes.action: Nationalise the 3rd party element of vehicle insurance to benefit young drivers.
attributes.background: My partner's daughter's insurance was £2000 per annum for any car before any accidents at the age of 18. She now has had an accident that wasn't her fault and the new premium will be £4000 per annum. She cannot use public transport to get to her job. This premium represents more than half her wages.
attributes.additional_details: Any alternative system exists in New Zealand and is quoted by Wikipedia as follows - "Within New Zealand, the Accident Compensation Corporation (ACC) provides nationwide no-fault personal injury insurance.[9] Injuries involving motor vehicles operating on public roads are covered by the Motor Vehicle Account, for which premiums are collected through levies on petrol and through vehicle licensing fees."

attributes.action: Introduce compulsory 6 weeks Comunity Service for 18-year-olds
attributes.background: There are some 750,000 18-year-olds in the UK. Their service to our nation would not only be an invaluable help to our understaffed, overstretched national health and education services but would also reestablish the commitment and responsibility we, as individuals, feel towards our community.
attributes.additional_details: Our nation’s young adults are able to bring the energy, enthusiasm and hard work to revitalize our public service sectors. Driving ambulances, escorting elderly patients to and from medical procedures and helping out in the classroom (with the necessary background checks); these six weeks would provide not only an immense service to our country but also an ideological grounding for its citizens. The UK is experiencing a time of increasing social divide in which our people feel estranged from the nation as a whole. Working hands-on with members of our community would deepen our understanding of our society and revolutionize the role we feel we play in it. An elevated feeling of responsibly towards our society will prove imperative to its success.

attributes.action: Privatise the NHS.
attributes.background: The privatisation of the NHS would mean taxes could be cut immensely or go to other areas. The privatisation would save money for the people as it will create more competition in the private market forcing lower prices for the competitive advantage of having cheaper care for the people.
attributes.additional_details: The NHS costs the average person £5,000 per year in taxes; the average person goes to the doctor's 4 times per year. If this was privatised then you would pay roughly £50 per visit, which is £200 per year. (This is based off American prices converted to pounds.) That is a lot of money to be saved per person. This extra money could grant lower taxes or more money going to other areas.

attributes.action: Debate the protection of vulnerable people from excessive insurance renewals
attributes.background:
The government needs to protect elderly and vulnerable people who are unable to look for and change to more competitive deals with alternative insurance providers for home insurance.

Which may result in the elderly person and property not being insured as the excessive cost is prohibitive
attributes.additional_details: I have personal experience of a number of elderly persons receiving excessive home insurance renewal premiums which were five times market rate. This is due to the insurance company's understanding that the elderly could be without internet access or otherwise isolated and would find it difficult or indeed impossible to move to cheaper alternative providers - and therefore incumbent insurance companies inflate renewals and any subsequent offers as there is no independent oversight available.

attributes.action: Make snow days in school a legal requirement when snowfall is over 2 inches.
attributes.background: I believe that england doesn't see much snow and when it does the children in schools need time to appreciate it. Maybe they could dabble in winter sports or just have a simple snowball fight. It can als be dangerous to get children to school as the roads will become icy and dangerous for driving.

attributes.action: Law requiring food chains to show the calories on menus.
attributes.background:
All food-service chains with 20 or more locations must post the number of calories in the food and drink items they sell.
This law should be implemented as it allows the public to count the amount of calories they eat. It can also reduce the chances of obesity.

attributes.action: Allow children to start school at 4
attributes.background: I have been told that my 3 year old will have to wait until he is 5 before he starts main stream school because his birthday is September(After June). Why can't children start when they are 4 or start them according to their learning and only hold them back if they need the extra help
attributes.additional_details: I personally would much rather my son have an extra year at school than an extra year in nursery.

attributes.action: Full-time employees to receive £100 bonus a month if they have no sickness
attributes.background: People who work full time, pay bills, have no help and have little left per month should be rewarded with a £100 incentive. This would make people working full time feel appreciated. The Government are helping the wrong people and its time for full-time workers to have a reward.

attributes.action: "PAMPER ON PRESCRIPTION" -  health professionals to prescribe holistic therapies
attributes.background: This idea could potentially save the NHS £millions.  As a sufferer from Mental Health issues I have often felt the need for relaxation to aid my stress levels, and have personal experience that even basic massage is the best relaxant and stress reliever ***(Please read 'more details' section)***
attributes.additional_details: The massage itself works wonders, but the talking that accompanies the treatment is also very therapeutic.  e.g. a simple hand massage.  To pay for these treatments can be relatively costly for me, but if I could access the therapies regularly, I would be able to cut down on expensive medication, thereby saving the NHS money.  I can advocate this idea as I know it works.

attributes.action: I want to start a petition to ban fixed odds betting machines in all book makers
attributes.background: I want to ban all fixed odd gaming machine in all bookmakers. I think these machines exploit people and the human brain, these bookmakers spend thousands of pounds in doing this. People have ruined thier own lives and people around them lives by playing these highly addictive machines.

attributes.action: Change the British military's standard issue rifle to the C8/L119
attributes.background: The British military's current rifle, the SA80/L85, is completely outclassed by the Colt Canada C8SFW Carbine, with its higher stopping power and rate of fire, already in use by special forces, the Royal Military Police and Royal Marine 43 Commando Fleet Protection Group
attributes.additional_details: Already a proven rifle, the swap would increase the effectiveness of a single infantry soldier in a firefight. The similarities to the US M4 would also allow spare parts to be used between us and our most powerful ally, and allow soldiers to pick up each other's weapons, for whatever reason, and already be used to an extremely similar one.

attributes.action: Introduce a separate, higher minimum wage for temporary workers and agency staff
attributes.background:
This petition is to help address the issue of unstable employment in our economy and to help promote the concerns about zero hour and temporary contracts. 
If temporary workers were given a higher minimum wage then this could encourage employers to offer permanent contracts and reduce exploitation.

attributes.action: Make all healthcare assistants registered and Band 3/4
attributes.background: Healthcare assistants are forefront in hospitals, care homes and many other places. Some healthcares have been working in the profession for 10years or more yet we are not reconigsed. We simply just known as 'just a healthcare assistant'
attributes.additional_details:
Help us get registered and recognised for what we do on Band 3/4
Healthcare assistants are not just bed bath washers or dinner deliverers.
We do bloods, cannultion, blood pressures, blood sugars,vaccines i.e flu vaccines, wound care along with patient personal care and comfort. 
For what we do in our job role we do not get the recongition like we should and to be on band 2 where secretaries are band 4 is unfair.

attributes.action: Ban the use of video interviews using computer analysis to select candidates
attributes.background: Many companies have began using video interviews in their application process. These interviews are reviewed by a computer and never seen by a person. The algorithms used cannot account for behavioural differences exhibited by people with disabilities and so, it removes them as viable candidates.
attributes.additional_details: Video interview algorithms are set up to analyses both verbal and non-verbal communication. The main problem with this system is that the characteristics which are deemed to be ‘good’ are generally characteristics which people with learning difficulties, such as ADHD or Aspergers will never display under the circumstances of a video interview. In an actual face to face interview, the interviewer can understand and account for the difference in communication while an algorithm cannot.

attributes.action: Ban gas stunning of animals
attributes.background: Gas stunning is a cruel method of killing animals. A video on YouTube made me aware of this horrid way animals are killed everyday. It should be made illegal.

attributes.action: Name one Dreadnought class submarine "HMS Thunder Child"
attributes.background: One of the new Dreadnought class submarines should be named "HMS Thunder Child" in honour of H.G. Wells' hero ship from War of the Worlds. This would infuse a sense of identity and culture being influenced by the famous literature of our nation.
attributes.additional_details: HMS Thunder Child is the fictional ironclad warship that destroys two Martian tripods in HG Wells' War of the Worlds before being sunk by a heat ray from a third tripod.

attributes.action: Make sadism a criminal offence
attributes.background:
This petition asks the government to create a new criminal offence called
 'Causing suffering for a sadistic cause'.
The act will cover all cases in which somebody deliberately physically or mentally harms a person in an unprovoked attack and then gets pleasure from their reaction/ suffering.
attributes.additional_details:
The crime will have a maximum sentence of 5 years imprisonment and will be classed in 3 rungs.

Rung A - max 5 years custody
Performing mental torture or depraved acts for a sadistic cause.

Rung B - max 2 years custody
Harming someone's mental or physical health in order to gain pleasure.

Rung C - max 6 months custody
Getting pleasure from the reaction or suffering of a person who has been mentally or physically harmed.

attributes.action: Stop Dartford toll fees.
attributes.background: The authorities said that as soon as the bridge was paid for the fees would stop.

attributes.action: UK referendum on the free movement of people from European Union countries.
attributes.background:
A referendum on free movement of people from the European Union is essential. 
 Let the country decide who can come here, with a simple yes or no referendum.

attributes.action: Put a tax on fish so fish can flourish more in the ocean.
attributes.background: Over fishing is declining fishes numbers so if there were a tax on buying them fishing would decline and the government would get more money.

attributes.action: Make UK taxpayers' salary and tax searchable and revealable to other taxpayers
attributes.background: Making taxpayers' salary revealable to other taxpayers is achievable with our digital tax system. Openness about salary and tax paid can act to reduce the gap between boardroom and shop-floor pay, gender pay gap and tax evasion.
attributes.additional_details: Any taxpayers whose salary is searched for and revealed will be able to see the name and ref number of the taxpayer who their salary and tax totals have been revealed to. This reduces spurious usage and makes it equitable in that the searcher's salary can be searched for too. Inequality thrives in dark corners, make salary and taxation more open in the UK!

attributes.action: Require all UK betting shops to have security screens to protect staff.
attributes.background: The Gambling Commission recommends such screens but it is down to the Local Authority who issue licences whether or not they are needed. It should be a legal requirement for all Betting Shops to have safety screens. All Betting Shops should have them, like banks and Post Offices do.

attributes.action: Introduce play as a statutory requirement across the primary national curriculum
attributes.background: Purposeful play is a central component of early years provision but the requirement for children to play should not end at Year 1. Play should be a requirement within the national curriculum ensuring all children are provided with opportunities for purposeful play across the primary age range.
attributes.additional_details: Play is a protected right for children under Article 31 of the United Nations Convention on the Rights of the Child. When planned and led effectively different types of purposeful play contribute to the spiritual, moral, social and cultural development of the child. Although some schools provide children with this opportunity beyond early years as part of their core provision this should be a requirement for all UK schools.

attributes.action: Change PE back to 60% practical 40% theory
attributes.background: If it’s called physical education, why is there more theory then practical?

attributes.action: Devolve Corporation Tax to the Scottish Parliament
attributes.background: We want lower taxes for businesses in Scotland, which probably means lower corporation tax rather than lower income tax. So now, I call on the UK government to devolve corporation tax.
attributes.additional_details: If the Scottish Parliament had the power to set corporation tax at a lower rate, then it would encourage more businesses to move up to Scotland. In my opinion, this would probably suit a lot of businesses. And I would also call on all parties at Westminster to work together to achieve this.

attributes.action: Make Staffordshire Bull terriers wear a harness or muzzle in public.
attributes.background:
My pet cat was savaged and killed by a Staffordshire bull terrier whilst the incompetent owner and his partner walked past my premises. 
The dog was not muzzled or in a harness, he was able to slip his lead and collar. The owner who had one arm in a sling at the time was unable to control him.
attributes.additional_details:
I am partially disabled and Ben is my only companion, this has had a devastating effect on my life. 
I reported the incident to the police and the Basildon Echo. 
The police are unable to do anything about it without identifying the owner. 
I have searched the neighbourhood and spoken with many local people but have been unable to find the owner. 
My MP encouraged me to start the petition and has spoken with the police on my behalf.

attributes.action: Restrict how soon shops, supermarkets can put out for sale Easter products.
attributes.background: This is destroying the spirit of Christmas and Easter as they are becoming one event. There should be a restriction that prevents shops from doing this, eg a time restriction of for example 8 weeks before Easter.
attributes.additional_details: Walking around my local Tesco supermarket on the 4th January I was confronted with Easter chocolates for sale (and we're talking proper Easter eggs, not just small cream eggs) I also understand some retailers had Easter out on New Years day. This is wrong and erodes the meaning of these events as they are becoming like the sales, an event that happens every day. It is not good for children to see things available so quickly as this does not teach them anything about the significance of the day.

attributes.action: Reduce income tax allowance discrepancy between UK worker & Tier2  employee
attributes.background:
A UK worker receives no taxfree allowance for paying utility bills, rent or council tax. Also, pays compulsory NI. 
A seconded worker under Tier2 Inter-Company Transfer scheme gets tax free allowance for paying utility bills, rents & council tax under Dispensation model plus optional NI for 2 years
attributes.additional_details:
ICT worker with £40,000 annual salary receives 20-40% of salary (£700-£1200 per month) as tax free allowance. 
E.g. Gross Pay=£40,000
Annual Income tax paid by ICT worker is £2,818.20
UK worker pays £9,518.52 
A normal UK worker pays 3 times the tax paid by a person on Tier2 seconded employee. Can government explain the reason behind this discrimination between UK & Non-UK employed person?  
Can government and HMRC explain what are the benefits of this system to the Great Britain & wider public?

attributes.action: Make schools and colleges have longer or more breaks between working times.
attributes.background: Many schools do not have long enough breaks between work periods, I suggest the solution that schools and colleges get more time at breaks or have breaks at regular intervals. Such as expanding a 15 minute break to being 25 minutes to encourage socialising to make school an enjoyable environment.

attributes.action: Allow people with amblyopia, also known as lazy eye to join armed forces
attributes.background: Ever since i was young i have wanted to join the armed forces and recently attempted to with the royal air force and was turned down at the medical stage, the problem? my eyesight in just one eye! I Don't see how having one bad eye can stop me from being a chef in the RAF
attributes.additional_details: Please change eyeseight rules and open doors for the many people suffering from Amblyopia.

attributes.action: Make it law that all shops have adequate cctv coverage.
attributes.background:
I had my phone stolen in a store in Westfield & this store did not have cctv. 
If cctv had been available, security could have checked to see if the offender was still in the area.
I'm sure I'm not the only person to experience this, nor the frustration that follows.

attributes.action: Require all car manufactures to offer retrofitting of L.E.D DRL
attributes.background:
I acknowledge that it is now a legal requirement for new cars to be fitted with DRL, however older vehicles can be retrofitted with them as they have a lot of benefits.
The point of the petition is to make it a legal requirement for all car manufactures to offer retrofitting LED DRL's
attributes.additional_details:
In the research conducted by the European Commision in 2006 it has been confirmed that they have potential in reducing road deaths due to making the vehicle more visible to other road users during the day and are then switched off when sidelights/dipped lights are switched on. 

Third party retrofitting systems are available but are not very reliable, hence why I wish all car manufactures to offer LED DRL's that would be installed by the manufacturer themselves.

attributes.action: Make the UK higher education system work like the US education system
attributes.background: In the first two years of study, in the American higher education system, you will generally be required to take a wide variety of classes in different subjects. I feel this is better than picking what you want to study ahead of going to university because you get a more rounded education.
attributes.additional_details:
One criticism of the American system is that teaching is more superficial than in UK higher education. I would argue, however, that students will gain a more rounded education this way. 

My reference for the way the HE system works in America is: https://www.studyusa.com/en/a/58/understanding-the-american-education-system

My reference for the American system being more superficial is: https://www.theguardian.com/higher-education-network/blog/2014/jun/30/uk-universities-better-education-dont-be-seduced-by-us

attributes.action: Free prescription charges in England
attributes.background:
Why should people in England be charged for prescriptions?
Why can the rest of the "United Kingdom" be exempt the same as Wales Scotland, Northern Ireland.
This is direct discrimination against anyone living in England.

attributes.action: Ban the use of high-frequency sonic deterrents against young people
attributes.background:
'Mosquitos' are devices deployed outside shops in public areas, with the aim of deterring loitering. They output high-energy 17400Hz waves, only heard by children and young adults.

This 108-decibel assault is painful, causes headaches, and discriminates against all young people.
attributes.additional_details:
Mosquito use infringes on section 14 (discrimination) of the European Convention on Human Rights and the Human Rights Act 1998. The Council of Europe has recommended in 2010 that it be banned.

Mosquito emissions are irritating, painful, and have been compared to forms of torture.

Kent County Council have already banned these on council-owned buildings - why are the Government not at least doing the same?

attributes.action: Abolish prohibited lanes for HGV overtaking on M11 and A14.
attributes.background: These stretches of the M11 and A14 where overtaking for HGV’s is prohibited are completely counter productive. They serve to prevent HGV’s overtaking for long periods and inconveniencing other road users.
attributes.additional_details: In reality these lanes create long tailbacks as faster/unladen HGV’s have to queue behind other slower/laden vehicles uphill with reduced speeds of sometimes 25-30mph. When the restriction ends all the faster HGV’s accerlerate pull out into lane 2 to overtake. These lanes are a complete false economy and are dangerous.

attributes.action: Cancel HS2 and use the allocated funds to help find a cure for cancer.
attributes.background: The debate on the long term benefits of HS2 and the use of an estimated £56bn of public funds on such a project have been going on for sometime. If the British public actually had a vote, would it be in favour of spending £56bn on HS2 or helping find a cure for cancer !
attributes.additional_details:
My mother has been battling with cancer for the last few years with the aid of vital treatments however a cure still doesn't exist and sadly  she has now been given months if not weeks to live as she is no longer responding to treatment.

A close family friend who stands to lose everything he's worked for much like countless others due to the HS2 project made a point that perhaps the funds could be better spent on something that could truly benefit each and everyone for generation to come.

attributes.action: Fund “Off The Street, Less Heat” youth project and similar projects
attributes.background: Off the Street, Less Heat is a youth diversion project which provides sports and other workshops to distract young people from anti-social behaviour, gang-related violence and street crime. Due to Government cuts, it and projects like it have lost funding.
attributes.additional_details: Off the Street, Less Heat was started in 2006/07 by Elaine Roberts, who came up with the name and idea, to help get young people off the streets and welcome people from all different communities. The project also aims to improve the relations between the police and the local community. Off the Street, Less Heat and similar projects all over the country need direct funding from the Government to ensure that they can continue.

attributes.action: Amend the Town and Country Planning Regulations on the flying of the EU flag
attributes.background: Under the 2007/2012 Planning Regulations flags can be flown without consent. Schedule 1 Class H allows: The flag of the Commonwealth, EU, UN, or any other international organisation of which the UK is a member. On 29/3/2019 the UK will leave the EU, hence flying the EU flag without consent must end.
attributes.additional_details:
The Town and Country Planning Regulations 2007 and amendment 2012, allows certain flags can be flown without consent, as set out within Schedule 1, Class H. 
One of these flags, the EU flag,  can be flown because it is a flag of an international organisation of which the UK is a member. From 29th March 2019 this will no longer be the case. Therefore, in future consent must be required.
The government’s guidance in “Flying flags: a plain English guide” must also be updated to reflect this change.

attributes.action: Add 1p Income Tax & Reduce Aid to OECD average to create a BREXIT readiness fund
attributes.background: I believe the majority of British People support Foreign Aid spending but feel we are spending a bit too much currently. I also believe our Country is in need of Strategic Infrastructure and Business Support Spending to help us during the pre Brexit and immediate post Brexit period.

attributes.action: Require all schools to allow boys to wear shorts.
attributes.background: Most schools no longer give boys the option to wear shorts except when taking part in physical education however all schools allow girls to wear skirts. This is sexist and should be resolved by requiring schools to allow boys to wear shorts.
